content: While driving by a Mini: Quinn: I see Daddy! Me: That's not your dad; it's a girl wearing earrings and a ponytail. Does your dad wear earrings and have long hair? Quinn: No...Daddy's just a face and a bottom.

title: Florida Vacation and Wedding
content: [typography font="Bree Serif" size="24" size_format="px"]Day One, the flight and arrival at Disneyworld.[/typography] We had a 5+ hour direct flight from SEA to Orlando. Everything basically went smoothly except for the EPIC Quinn meltdown during the last 1/2 hr of the flight. Poor kid, he didn't sleep much and it caught up with him. We stayed at the Disney Beach Club Villas. [hr] [typography font="Bree Serif" size="24" size_format="px"]Day Two, rained out at the Animal Kingdom, sort of.[/typography] Raining really hard when we got up and headed to the Animal Kingdom. Eventually we broke down, bought a few rain ponchos and made the best of it. Penn was a tough guy and went on the "Dinosaur" ride with Mom, telling me afterward that it was "a little scary" and that "Quinn shouldn't go on it". The Kali River Rapid ride was a big hit. We did the Fast Pass and waited less than 10 minutes, excellent! The Boneyard which was basically a glorified McDonalds Playland, was a hit as well. [gallery ids="3742,3743,3744,3745,3746,3748"] [hr] [typography font="Bree Serif" size="24" size_format="px"]Day Three, Twistin' by the pool.[/typography] Hung out at the pool today and the boys (4 1/2yrs now) loved it. It's definitely not a full blown water park like Typhoon Lagoon or Blizzard Beach but for us it was awesome. There's a fairly good sized water slide that Penn went on about 763 times in a row (no rides for Quinn of course) and a shallow, sand bottomed pool with a man-made sandbar that seems to keep the little ones entertained throughly. Also a small-ish lazy river. [gallery ids="3755,3756,3757,3758,3759,3760,3761,3749"] [hr] [typography font="Bree Serif" size="24" size_format="px"]Day Four, Magic Kingdom, smores and outdoor movie.[/typography] We began the day at the Magic Kingdom park. Great weather and not particularly busy. Tom Sawyer island was hit as was Buzz Lightyear and surprisingly the People Mover. [gallery ids="3844,3845,3846,3847,3848,3849,3850,3851,3852,3853,3854,3855,3856,3857,3858,3859,3860,3861,3862,3863,3864,3865,3866,3867,3868"] Later in the day we had smores and a outdoor movie showing of Little Mermaid. [gallery ids="3836,3835,3834,3833,3832,3831,3830,3829,3828,3827,3826,3825,3824"] Quinn Dancing [hr] [typography font="Bree Serif" size="24" size_format="px"]Day Five, the drive south to Jupiter.[/typography] We left Disneyworld at noon-ish and headed south for Jupiter. Easy drive.

title: Daily Drip - 09-11-2012
content:
Fun day at Lake Union!! We saw "pirate" ships, sea planes and played in the fountain (life jackets and all). :-) 
They did amazing at swimming. They can really swim without life jackets now.  Both boys were excited, not a peep about not wanting to go and they asked for Mrs. Jen all morning. Penn even got upset when I passed the WAC to park, lol. 

-- 
April 

[gallery columns="4"]

title: Friends on a Saturday

[nggallery id=6]

Much fun in the pool today. Hot 95+. PennQuinn started out slow but quickly got their swim on.

title: Daily Drip for 08-17-2012
content: Good day at swim overall... Quinn a little tired. Quinn and Penn quotes on the way to swim.... [quote]"Hurry catch up to Mommy. Don't crash her, she's my nice Mommy. I love Mommy, Daddy and April. She's a very nice Mommy, don't crash her. Go slow, ok April?"[/quote] [nggallery id=4]

title: Daily Drip for 08-15-2012
content:
Great day at swim! They went in the deep end today to do their jumps! They jump in, come up for air, float on their back and swim back mostly independently. (all at once). Fun day at the beach! These boys don't like to get dirty. We were working on getting messy without complaining, it was a little hard for them (mostly Quinn). I carried them through the seaweed. I shouldn't have pointed it out, lol. Rain-boots next time. :) (While driving to swim class)
Quinn, "April look at me. Turn around and look at me. Can you go around that car?" April asks, "Why? Am I not going fast enough? (he wanted to get to swim class faster, lol)  
  [nggallery id=5]

title: Siro Pacenti winery - Montalcino Italy
content:
8 Minutes at a wonderful winery in Tuscany. Giancomo Pacenti is a rock-star. His 2006 Brunello Di Montalcino got a 95pt rating recently in Wine Spectator (the 01' got 97 pts!). We were lucky enough to show up on a day when they were sorting the 2011 harvest.


http://vimeo.com/31472057
excerpt: 8 Minutes at a wonderful winery in Tuscany. Giancomo Pacenti is a rock-star. His 2006 Brunello Di Montalcino got a 95pt rating recently in Wine Spectator (the 01' got 97 pts!). We were lucky enough to show up on a day when they were sorting the 2011 harvest.

excerpt: Me driving our 9 person van down the tiny streets of Montalcino, Italy.

title: Sestadisopra Wine Tasting with Mr. Spina
content:
Ok, so I know this video is really long by PennQuinn.com standards. I just felt I needed to put it all out there.

Sestadisopra is a small winery we visited on our 2011 Italy trip. Family owned by Mr. Ettora Spina, they produce some fantastic Brunello (95pts WS!) from the South-facing upper hillsides of Montalcino. Mr. Spina was fantastic. We had to make an appointment to visit them and he didn't disappoint. He met us as we drove up his long gravel driveway and welcomed us to "his home."  The tasting was awesome, 2006 Rosso Di Montalcino and 2006 Brunello Di Montalcino. We also purchased a 06 Riserva (Magnum only.) Looking forward to busting it open in a few years.

Ciao.

http://vimeo.com/30950027
